Searching for Differences and Conflicts

To find differences and conflicts in a Visual Merge comparison, use any combination of the following:

  • Scroll through the files looking for changes in color. Specific colors indicate differences between the files or file revisions. For an explanation of these colors, see Looking at the Visual Merge Window. Use the scroll bar to move forward and backward in both files.

  • Select Search > Next Difference on the menu, or click the Next Difference button on the toolbar to move forward to the next difference.

  • Select Search > Previous Difference on the menu, or click the Previous Difference button on the toolbar to move back to the previous difference.

  • Select Search > Next Conflict on the menu, or click the Next Conflict button on the toolbar to move forward to the next line that has changed.

  • Select Search > Previous Conflict on the menu, or click the Previous Conflict button on the toolbar to move back to the previous line that has changed.
